website_summaries.verdict: The KEEN Voyageur’s promise of comfort and support is resolute. It does not require any break-in at all. Many admired the shoe for being lightweight and having a spacious interior, especially around the toe box.However, many users were dissatisfied with the quality and durability of the materials. The interior and exterior construction are incomparable to the quality Keen was known for. Disgruntled consumers were not happy with the price they have spent on the shoe. In conclusion, users are adviced to weigh the advantages and disadvantages.
pros: KEEN Voyageur fans were greatly impressed with how comfortable the shoes were
It did not require any breaking in at all, as affirmed by several users who wore it for the first time during their hikes
According to a significant number of users, the Voyageur offered a huge amount of support, especially in the heel area
The roomy toe box allowed a majority of buyers to spread their toes without restrictions while wearing it
One of the well-liked qualities of the Voyageur from KEEN, according to some consumers, is that it is lightweight
A professional blogger raved about the shoe’s wide enough confines
Its fantastic breathability was lauded by a few reviewers, which include a seasoned critic
cons: The lining of the Voyageur was tattered after a few weeks of use, as cited by a handful
A substantial number of users were displeased with the colors as they were too bold
A high fraction of KEEN stalwarts were frustrated when the sole separated quickly from the rest of the shoe after only a few weeks
They complained that this wasn’t the KEEN quality they were used to
The stitching and eyelets on the upper deteriorate after a short period of time, as experienced by a few
Paying more than $100 for this shoe is dismaying, according to a number of upset consumers

customer_reviews.title: Beware when buying this shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these and the came in looking great. Two days later the glue on the shoes started to come apart. I returned them for a new pair and now two months later the new pair is falling apart. Very cheap and the glue does not hold the shoe together. If you want these shoes go in person to REI and purchase to make sure they are held together good. Sad I wasted over 100 on these shoes and can't even enjoy them. Wouldn't doubt this is a counterfeit.
customer_reviews.author: Jon-Ivette

customer_reviews.title: Really lousy
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this brand, style and size for almost 6 years now. I have particularly wide feet, and these have always fit me very well. This pair I just got is is made in China according to the label, and they don't fit well at all. They are narrower across the body than usual and very uncomfortable. I honestly wonder if they are knock-offs. Anyhoo - I'm a very loyal Keen shopper (I've bought at LEAST 20 of these shoes)- and they quality and fit are not what it used to be. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: D. Karns

customer_reviews.title: Did my Feet Grow?
customer_reviews.text: Reordered this pair to replace exact style and size of my old ones. They feel fine around the house for an hour or two, but I could barely finish a 5K hike, with gravel and hills. The toe nail on my second toe is still bruised after a month. Now I'm looking for different brand as I can't wear these. I suppose a larger size might fix problem, but I'm surprised this size was fine for the old pair. kind of soured me on Keen.
customer_reviews.author: MontereyJake

customer_reviews.title: stable to hike in and supportive of bad arches with some inserts
customer_reviews.text: Only hiking shoe my husband and I buy anymore because we know it will fit. Most other brands run too narrow or inconsistent in sizing. These are comfy right out of the box, stable to hike in and supportive of bad arches with some inserts. Sometimes the heel wears out on the inside and rubs the back of my ankles. Just putting that in there for Keen to know. It's happened a couple of times now after months of hiking in them. Wool socks seem to help on that.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisTop Contributor: Mountain Biking

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy the shoes. They will fall apart just like the other reviewers. The sole ends up separating from the upper. I created a warranty claim, but the refund they give you is only good for their web site which is drastically marked up.
customer_reviews.author: Gear Lab

customer_reviews.title: Craptastic insole
customer_reviews.text: I've had this model before, so no surprises. I ordered it a 1/2 size larger, should have stayed at the same size (not sure why -- I guess I wanted to see if they fit different, or I couldn't read the size). Should have stayed where I was. Typical Keen -- crepe paper insole. I have been using the Timberland Pro with good results. They should at least put the lowest of their line of aftermarket insoles in them. I can't imagine they would cost $5 more WITH a little profit thrown in.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Not like those you bought before
customer_reviews.text: Now the material is a lot stiffer, less flexible, I did not read other reviews but I will from now on, you create a brand with a great product but did management make you go to a cheaper rubber and now they are not what your customers wanted, so like all the brands that lost faith with thier loyal customers who later had wished they had not gotten so greedy and used cheaper materials, you get yours in the end, no customers.
customer_reviews.author: William Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Keen finally got better
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing keen targhees since 2006 and keen voyageurs since 2008. I go through about a pair of each per year. Each year they seem like they get a little flimsier, a little cheaper, a little crappier. But this year (2020) the targhees and the voyageurs have gotten a lot better. i'm just not in love with the 2020 colors. These give excellent support and fit for people with wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Conspicuous Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to start off by saying I love keen shoes. They make a awesome product. I wanted to give a higher rating but the quality im used to isn't there. Leather is good breathable fabric is good. These are low top so i need to use every eyelet for my laces. That is were the stiching is not perfect. Right foot top stiched eyelet was missing. Luckly it is a easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: What happened to quality!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had shoes for 3 weeks and they started falling apart. I love keens, but if this is the direction they are going with their quality... I AM DONE WITH KEENS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Just1davis

customer_reviews.title: Stitching rips out in toe after 3 months!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Started wearing these shoes in late January. The stitching has ripped out on the toe of the shoe. Water gets in and my feet get all wet. What happened to the good quality these shoes are known for? I have bought at least 7 pairs for work in the past and were a great shoe. I guess as everything else these companies start contracting out their product to foreign companies for more profit. Shame. Here are pictures showing the sole, that these shoes have barely been worn. The other picture shows the rip in the toe. Waste of $$.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Jeffcoat

customer_reviews.title: Buy this model/design of Keens; see a podiatrist on what insoles to buy. I have fibromyalgia.
customer_reviews.text: These are my “every day” shoes- this is my 3rd pair of Keens, each lasting 2-3 years of everything! The shell-toe is brilliant; offering more width in the toe and extra protection (not steel or composite, the rubber’s great!). I did add (in all 3 pair) a podiatrist recommended insole (removing but keeping the stock insoles). I was a “Sketchers Forever” guy, but Keens, while costing more, have been the best I’ve ever worn.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love keens especially for hiking trails. When you have to climb or descend steep hard packed tails the trad holds very well. Theses are not my first pair. I had the tigers fro several years when they go stolen from the front porch ( “homeless” drug addicts in the area.) Other wise I’m sure I would still be getting a lot more use out of them I was looking for black on black. Could not find any but these black olive look great. Just don’t really like the salty orange decor on them.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Keens are awesome shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair 3 or 4 years ago. Wear them almost daily. Very comfortable and well made. I just bought this pair in case my first pair should start to wear out, but they still have plenty of life and are not showing wear other than on the tread. I'm sold on Keens! My feet are wide flat. Most other shoes I've tried are either not super comfortable or else wear out fast. My Keens are extremely comfortable and are super durable. Love em!
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Keen! What did you do? I used to ...
customer_reviews.text: Keen! What did you do? I used to be able to walk into REI and grab a pair of Keens without even trying them on. Now, they are all too short. I tried going up from a 9 to a 10.5 and still my toe was pressing against the tip of the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Like wearing pillows on your feet...
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They are so comfortable to wear. I bought them for work doing roofing and general home repair type activities. Since my feet are wide they fit really well and offer all day comfort. Have already bought another pair in a different color (on sale) since I will likely trash them before they have an opportunity to wear out. This review may be a little biased, as I already have 14 other pairs of Keen shoes. As long as Keen keeps using this design formula, I will keep buying them, if they stop, I will stop buying Keen. Are you listening Keen??
customer_reviews.author: AzRider

customer_reviews.title: Excellent walker.  Good ventilation
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in July 2019. I’m not on the trails like I used to be so they are primarily used as a walking shoe. I like these better than my Merrill Moab shoes and boots, Targhee 2 and Targhee 3. They don’t pick up all the sticks, stones and ud that my Moabs did. Better comfort, fit, looks, and feel. My high arches require support for plantar fasciitis and these are perfect with WalkHero orthotics.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Green

customer_reviews.title: CHEAPLY MADE.....  NOT WORTH THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I have been a keen fan for years.... but that has come to a bitter end. The last two pair I have purchased have been below the quality that I had grown accustomed too. Keen has dropped there standards and there shoes don’t hold up like they used to. Sad to say I will not be buying them again!! Stitching has gone cheap and they break down with in a month of average day wear nothing crazy just normal daily routine. Now to find a better shoe quality!!
customer_reviews.author: Tate Bailey

customer_reviews.title: seemed a bit large to me
customer_reviews.text: my worn out Keens were a 9, so I bought the same size with these. Turned out to be longer and wider than expected. I returned them. Could have gotten 1/2 size smaller, but I decided that for a shoe this heavy, it's more comfortable for me to have some ankle support. I wanted these to work; they're the most attractive Keens IMO, but they're not for me. Seemed pretty well made, roomy toe box, good tread.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Had to knock a few stars off; lateral stability in the heel is horrible. Great shoe otherwise though. I did buy the mid-boot; it is BETTER for stability...but because of the bood part. It is still unstable in the heel. I’ll probably buy another pair...eithe Soloman or Merril...if they are just as horrible...I’ll gofe the stars back. *************** Love them. Ordered the 13's. Slightly roomy; can wear another pair of thin socks to firm up for a long walk. I usually don't for casual walking about house and town and they are fine. Will probably buy the mid version too!
customer_reviews.author: J just J

customer_reviews.title: Very good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality shoe, very comfortable. Feet dry after several hours in wet grass. Would definitely buy again. Sizing was a challenge. I normally wear 10.5 or 11. Purchased 11, which felt good but I could feel a li'l bit of big toe touch up front, so it seemed likely I would have toe jam problems with downhill hiking. Sent them back for 11.5, which is the slightest bit big on my foot, but very comfy with a thick-ish sock. And no more concerns about toe jam.
customer_reviews.author: Viggles

customer_reviews.title: What has happen to Keen?
customer_reviews.text: Man, I've been a huge advocate for these shoes and this company, but this last pair was total garbage. the bottom sole started delaminating from the uppers within just a few weeks of wear. Sent them back for refund, again, terrifically disappointed with the product itself, I'm probably going back to Merrell's after this experience..
customer_reviews.author: Doriann Tronick

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe I’ve ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the eighth pair of voyageurs I’ve bought. I usually have a new pair waiting before I start using the pair I bought previously. They just fit... perfectly. I have wide feet and high arches, and these are the most comfortable shoe I’ve ever bought. Not sure what I’ll do when I can no longer find them. The only downside is that the soles don’t grip well on ice. Not surprising given their design, but I wear them all year in places like colorado and Wisconsin so it’s been a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: Quality control is gone
customer_reviews.text: These shoes lasted me 5 weeks, not even hiking, just around the house. They’re garbage. I have been wearing Keen’s for 10 years. The last 2 the heels and rubber pieces of the soles come apart after 2 months of light use, not even hiking. If your life can depend on your shoes on a hike these aren’t for you. They come apart like the glue is Elmers.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph V. Rome Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and confortable
customer_reviews.text: I had to return and reorder. But it was quick and easy. Size was off by 1/2 a size. I got the right size only a couple days after returning. The fit was perfect. I would totally recommend this seller. The quality is great out of box. They look of good quality. Keen is a solid brand. I still have my first set for 15 years. I also bought there work boot for contruction and they are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Terrible insoles.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe itself seems fine so far, but the insoles are a different story. The insoles themselves are too thin, and uncomfortable. Also, I ordered a size 12 shoe, and one of the insoles was for a size 10 shoe. I could feel my toes hanging over, and it wasn't pleasant. For a $100 pair of shoes, it seems that the insoles could be better, as well as the quality control.
customer_reviews.author: bill66

customer_reviews.title: 6 week review
customer_reviews.text: I first ordered a size 16 but was a bit too small so returned for a size 17 which is a tad too large but better. I have no complaints so far with this boot and will be wearing on some hard trails soon. So I will give a more detailed review in a few months on how they wear with time and miles. I really appreciate being able to get these in a size 17, it isn't easy in most brands.
customer_reviews.author: Woodpecker44

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but poor traction.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Only draw back is the tread on bottom of shoe is lacking (i.e., not deep enough with secondary poor traction). Tested on several rocky hard hikes and continued with frequent slipping. Don't have that problem with my other hiking shoes (other higher end brands). Also, hard to draw shoe laces up tight. Overall, will go with another shoe next time.
customer_reviews.author: JD 007

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable shoes perfect for men who work outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, durable and excellent fit! The shoes are great work shoes with comfort and style. My husband was going through a pair of Timberlands every few months and they lacked the comfort and tread grip that Keens offer. I’m honestly kind of upset that we wasted so much money on all of the other shoes when these were literally hiding in plain site...
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Third pair and I keep coming back for more
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd pair of Keen voyageur's I've owned. I love them. They are the most comfortable shoe I have ever owned. They're ventilated, so not waterproof, but the ventilation keeps them cool and prevents heavy sweat buildup. The toe box os also wider than most shoes so your feet feel much more comfortable than in other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: These are a great fit and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I am on my feet all day and do a lot of walking on hard surfaces. I was also starting to have problems with pain in my heels. I felt immediate relief of all discomfort as soon as I put these sneakers on, and now my feet still feel great at the end of the day. When these wear out, I will definitely be purchasing another pair.
customer_reviews.author: TJB

customer_reviews.title: Too small and lasted only 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these at the end of January to replace my first pair which I owned for 5 years. They weren't as long as the other size 12 pair, and they took my roughly a month to break in and then the heels wore holes in them shortly after, and now the sole is coming off. Do not purchase these. The price no longer matches the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ahall

customer_reviews.title: Advertised size (painfully) strikes again
customer_reviews.text: Overall shoe appeared fine re workmanship. Amazon reviews regarding longevity disconcerting poor, but price is right relative to local footwear stores. Ordered size/width identical to existing pair of shoes to replace worn-out footwear. Delivered shoes were marked as previous version but were actually 1/2-1 size too small. Returned item and waiting for replacement. Based on reviews, these replacements will probably be little more than garbage but Amazon is good about taking things back and what the h***, they pay shipping both ways.
customer_reviews.author: PPel46

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes. Wide enough and durable
customer_reviews.text: These are the only shoes I wear now. I am a Park Ranger so they get abused daily. My old pair <year and a half> was looking kinda rough so I put them in the wash and dried in the sun. They look fairly new again. Ohh and if you have wide feet you will love these shoes. Has great arch support too.
customer_reviews.author: Rubysunshineditmore

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable through rough mixed terrain.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get some new hiking shoes for an upcoming summer hike. I have Keen sandals and loved them, so I though I'd give the shoes a try. I've been hiking three times over mixed terrain and so far they've been very comfortable. They fit well in the heel with plenty of room in the toe box. goiong on steep up an down hills haven't produced any discomfort from toe jams or heel slippage. I also got them soaked from a stream crossing, and the Keens dried quickly and did not change the fit (some boots I've owned changed shape and fit after getting wet). So far after 20ish miles over challenging terrain, I've been very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M. Stergios

customer_reviews.title: My Second Pair
customer_reviews.text: I use the shoes for walking. The first pair lasted for 2 1/2 years. Walked on mostly hard surfaces, 4 miles every day (almost). Had to have another pair. This is the only shoe I've found that has a good width for my foot. Also, the Voyageur doesn't slip up and down on my heels. The Targa does, as do some other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R. Newsom

customer_reviews.title: Heel area wears thru
customer_reviews.text: As an older person with various foot issues, this shoes technically was perfect for my needs...good arch and hell support, generous width in box, and ample ball of foot padding...BUT, rather rapidly, the area right behind the heel wore thru. I do have a slight bone protrusion, but still, should not have worn thru to the bare shoe at the back so quickly...
customer_reviews.author: S. Ebert

customer_reviews.title: A bit small in length
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10 in sneakers and these shoes run about a half size small so the end of my toes are right at the end of the toe box with very little room to spare. I walked about five miles in them so too late to send back. I would recommend ordering one half size larger than what you normally wear. Other than the tight fit they seem to be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Hopkins Henry

customer_reviews.title: Now a full size too small
customer_reviews.text: The Keen Voyageur as been my favorite all around shoe for several years. I wear a 17 and they are great for work or hikes. I've ordered 7 pairs over the last three years and they have all been great. But the last two pairs that I got have been too small....probably a full size too small and have been returned. I thought perhaps the first pair was a fluke but the second pair was also small. At size 17, there's no next size up to order to replace it so I'm just out of luck. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: The fit is the same as my previous two pair. I tend to wear these out because they fit comfortably on my fat foot. I do own three other models of Keens so use this recommendation with a little care. These breath better than all but my sandals. I love them or I wouldn’t be on my third pair.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect wide toe box shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have such a hard time finding hiking shoes with a wide toe box that don't slip on my heel -- these fit the bill so well that I've bought a couple as back up. They are super comfortable and have great grip. I'm distressed to see the negative reviews and that they might be discontinuing them? Argh, this always happens to me. Hello world, we need more shoes like this!!
customer_reviews.author: davisite

customer_reviews.title: Nice at first, but durability is a concern over time
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these shoes at first. I wear them as my daily shoe, rarely wearing anything else. My complaint is durability. After about a month, parts of the rubber sole where becoming unglued from the shoe. After about 6 months, and using shoe goo to try to fix the issues, its falling apart in many areas, including the durable looking toe, cracking and splitting and becoming detached from the leather portion of the toes. I'm disappointed since I am a fan of Keen, having a pair of their sandals and really liking them. I think I will need to buy another brand to replace these however.
customer_reviews.author: B. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Soles are no longer durable
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this model of Keens for the past 5-10 years and each pair has lasted about a year, at which point the sole has worn down enough that there's no longer sufficient cushioning. I do a fair amount of hiking, so that seemed fine to me, but lately the durability has been getting progressively worse each year. My latest pair lasted 3 months and now the cushioning in the sole is completely worn out. Aside from the durability, they're great shoes, but this will be my last pair of Keens for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Dallas

customer_reviews.title: shabby construction as of late
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I've been buying them for years. I still have the first pair I bought, and still wear them for yard work. They look like they've been through hell, and they have, but they're still intact. The pairs I've bought after that have fallen apart and a pair I just bought a few months ago, my fourth, the soles are coming off. I believe they changed the glue they use to something cheaper. I'm writing directly to Keens to complain.
customer_reviews.author: EEA

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting shoe.. Looks just like the expected from website.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits perfect for my feet. I have been buying Keen Products for a while now and keep going back to them for the best fit for my feet. These feel lighter than I expected but have a firm foot base and plenty of grip.
customer_reviews.author: R Magee

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. Great manufacturer. Buy ‘em.
customer_reviews.text: My third pair of the exact same shoes. Each pair wore the outside of the heel down after two years. Still comfortable though. The reason they wore out was 365 days a year of NYC walking. It’s all concrete!!! Best hiking shoes ever though.
customer_reviews.author: RealNewYorker

customer_reviews.title: Inexcusable wear on the sole. Avoid these.
customer_reviews.text: After only a couple days this giant chunk of rubber came loose from the sole. Other sections followed. Otherwise a nice quality shoe, but inexcusable quality on the sole. It will not last and I do not recommend buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Master Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Heels wear out very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of keens I have owned and all three have had the heel wear abnormally. To bad Keen can't solve a obvious problem to a very good shoe. On the last pair I found an object under the fabric. This is the last time I will but any Keen.
customer_reviews.author: Al Deathe

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: This product kicks ass. I am toetally impressed. It feetures incredible longevity, and runs circles around the competition. If you lace your shopping cart with several of these shoe-ins, or place it as your sole order, your wallet will soon heel, as the over-arching value is nothing to stick your tongue out at.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Coming apart after two days
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes after seeing other contractors trying Keens. I wear a 16 so I was unable to get the types of boots I was seeing. I received these shoes on 8/24/2020 and started wearing them on 8/25. On 8/27, after just two days of wearing them I noticed they were already coming apart. I wasn't putting them through any harsh conditions other than walking a lot. I like the shoes fine but am very disappointed they are already coming apart and am going to attempt returning them for a replacement pair.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good value boot!  I hope they make them longer than a year... :)
customer_reviews.text: As I would expect from Keen, these fit as advertised and are well made. The "Orange" color is a twinge closer to "Peach" out of my Crayola box... But this shoe ventilates nicely and is comfortable. Got a real trial today in the snow and I was not disappointed with the traction or insulation. Obviously this is not a "snow" boot, but it does very well overall. I would buy another pair when these wear out, which as I would expect from Keen, will be 11 days after they discontinue the line... :)
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Beck II

customer_reviews.title: Keen - Great shoe for bunion discomfort
customer_reviews.text: I had read good reviews regarding Keen shoes. So, when a bunion started giving me more pain than usual, I decided to give Keen a try. I chose this model because of the closed shoe design. The Keen shoe gave extra support and a great width. Now? Zero to little bunion pain. I'm not saying it's a cure for everyone with bunion pain but Keen worked for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great show for a few months
customer_reviews.text: Product fit is great. I have owned sever keen shoes over the years and have had great luck with them. I know from past shoes if you need good support you will need to get a new insert. Keen even makes some that are good. I love the larger toe box. My only complaint is this pair my left sho has a hole in the heal material. I will typicaly get this on shoes however it typicaly will take 1 year. With these it was 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley J Stevensen

customer_reviews.title: Solid. 💪🏻My best shoes for a year and a half .
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes on April 6, 2017. I’ve worn them almost every day for a year and a half. They were by far the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever owned. I wore them in snow, ice, rain and all summer long. The photo I posted this what the shoes look like today. After a year and a half of abuse mostly in the streets if New York City. The only reason I upgraded to The Targhee 2 waterproof is because there’s a small hole in the sole and some water was beginning to seep in when it rained.
customer_reviews.author: Pa

customer_reviews.title: Great Comfort, Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Keen hiking-style shoes have become my favorite. I did a lot of research and tried many types/styles on in stores before getting these, and I've not regretted the decision. I also have the high-top boots for winter/hiking, etc., and they've lasted 1.5 years. These are better than the high-tops for casual wear (for me) since they lace and tie like normal shoes (versus boots where you have to string up the top). The end result is the same for me though, great traction, awesome comfort, and no water in the shoe. I can't speak to how they do in hiking conditions, but for general wear in conditions, my experience has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: The Best Trail and Hiking Shoe for a Wide Fore Foot.
customer_reviews.text: After Foot Surgery I needed new shoes to due widening of my toe from C/D to Wide. The only shoe and boots that have a regular heel and a wide, comfortablely tall toe box with protected rubber (?) Coating that has never come loose dispite all the rocks I kick [Arizona].
customer_reviews.author: DocTin

customer_reviews.title: My Third Pair of Keen Voyageurs
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of Keen Voyageurs that I have purchased. I love them. Other shoes are not built wide enough for my feet. I love the bumper toes for when I'm doing carpentry or mechanics work. I had my last pair for 4 years and used and abused the heck out of them doing all sorts of work and play out doors. I had forgotten how much break in they require. My old ones were absolutely comfortable. Too bad there's no way to have them simply resoled, there was nothing wrong with the uppers.
customer_reviews.author: AUSTIN

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe on Concrete all day
customer_reviews.text: This is about my 6th pair of this Keen shoe in the last 10 years. I wear them all day, every work day, walking and standing on concrete all day. The only thing I need to do is add a thin insole to the show as the ones that come with them are not soft enough.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Quality isn't what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: Seems like Keen has taken some focus off the quality. The sides are plastic with a lace that runs through it. Should the lace give way or break, it virtually makes the shoe unusable as you can no longer tie to to a snug fit. I was able to fix mine by pulling out a good old needle and heavy duty thread and stitching the, now two, laces back together. Though they aren't the worst shoe I've ever had, they are not the Keens I was excited to open the box to.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes poor  packaging
customer_reviews.text: I like keen make my feet feel well balanced but today with poor packaging they came ruffed up with impact marks and not worth full price and I have a hiking trip in two days. Update change to 4 star Thank you for getting them out by Friday :)
customer_reviews.author: KGB

customer_reviews.title: comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.text: I tend to supinate (walk or run with most of the weight on the outside of the feet) and bought these shoes on the recommendation of a local shoe seller. She knew what she was talking about. Instead of prematurely wearing out the outside of the soul from heel to toe, they've tended to wear a lot more evenly for me, and therefore last significantly longer, and they make for a very supportive, comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: D. V. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Best light hiking/walking shoes I've bought.
customer_reviews.text: I now have four identical pairs of this shoe in various stages of wear. I did replace the liners with Super Feet simply because of a personal choice. Never even tried the liners that came with the shoes. I needed shoes having plenty of width in the toe area for a bunion and these turned out to be perfect. If I needed another pair of walking/hiking shoes, I would select this one again but with four pairs I good for now.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD L. DAVIS

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite shoe, I even wear them to work daily
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite shoe, I even wear them to work daily. The color for this configuration is good even with slacks. Unfortunately I had to return this particular pair as the left shoe insert had a hump in it that made the shoes unbearable to wear. I am still wearing my old pair though, best fitting shoes ever!
customer_reviews.author: AmVan78

customer_reviews.title: Keen Shoes Are The Best
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing keen shoes for hiking and work for the last 6 years and have had nothing but good luck. Theese shoes last incredibly well even under hard or extreme use. They also breath very well while also keeping your feet relatively dry in wet conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chronic

customer_reviews.title: Best pair of shoes I own
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable shoes I own. While they are not appropriate for every situation, I.e. Not to dressy, I have been wearing them as much as possible. I also work on a hard cement surface for several hours each day, and find these keen shoes to be the best shoes I have found for working on hard surfaces as well as being great hiking and rough terrain shoes.
customer_reviews.author: NerveStorm

customer_reviews.title: Keen makes the best shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Have settled on Keen's for a few years --- haven't found another brand that has the arch support like Keen has. Very comfortable. FYI.... these are my 5th pair of Keen's.
customer_reviews.author: thomas j. eastes

customer_reviews.title: I Love These Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with these Keens. They style is very cool and I love the colors. They're well made and very comfortable. When these wear out, I'll probably try to find another pair just like them. They're my favorite casual shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable out of the box. Watch the size order .5 size bigger. I normally wear 10 had to return first pair and re-order 10.5 after that all good on the fit. Had the Voyageur boot prior which lasted about 3 years (worn 5 days a week) and still had plenty of life but unfortunately the new puppy got to them and chewed the heals off. Although the bottom lamination started to come apart around the sides. A little Gorilla Glue fix it.
customer_reviews.author: SCarbo

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes from a great company
customer_reviews.text: I regularly purchase Keen shoes in a variety of styles. As usual, I'm not disappointed with this pair. They have a wider toe box than their competitor's shoes that I have purchased, which works well for me. They also hold up to rough treatment.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: These or Chacos; go-to summer shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot, and fortunately Keen is still making them the way they always have, unlike most of my favorite long-dead styles. Good ventilation, great summer shoe. Not at all waterproof. In the summer, it's these or Chacos.
customer_reviews.author: isiton?

customer_reviews.title: Superb hiker
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional hiker that I have owned many times. Tried the others but for fit and width and support and stability. Wear it everyday to the office and out on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: PA hiker

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. Bought 1st pair at local retailer 3 weeks ago. Like them so much I ordered another pair in different color. Very comfortable, wear them 12 to 14 hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: Clem

customer_reviews.title: Runs a bit wide.  Sole disintegrates after just a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for three months. They fit fine but feel too wide, even though my feet are on the wide side. The width can make them somewhat uncomfortable after a couple of hours of walking on an uneven rocky trail. The're okay for short open space hikes but I would not recommend them for off trail hiking in the mountains or for all day hikes. After just four months the sole layers started to peel away from one another and the whole sole started to break apart.
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoes
customer_reviews.text: Recommend order half size up for better comfort because it runs a little small. It arrived on time and the shoes were new as expected. It has good durability. They are a bit bulky and wide so they don’t look as aesthetic (they’re not W)
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: My husband finally wore out his old Keens. We didn't even know if these were still made. They are the best and last a long time. They have the wide toe box, like most Keens, good arch support, not too wide heel,and a perfect fit for his size 12. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: barbie thompson

customer_reviews.title: Lasts
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair bought at garage sale- $5.00. Best shoe ever had. Wore it out, thus this pair. Say what you will, I like this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: steven puelz

customer_reviews.title: Good boots!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! This is my second pair. The first lasted fine, but after a couple years of wearing, they're still good but getting worn down and I wanted a second backup pair. My feet are very wide and these are normal width, so it'll take a month of wearing them before the expand enough (and I know they will). Happy with them!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been through several pairs of these shoes - he says they are comfortable - and they must be as I haven't seen him wear any of his other shoes for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: PatC

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: this is my second pair. just as good as the first didn't wear out. one for my summer home and one for my winter home
customer_reviews.author: retired doc

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: Well made and attractive trail shoe. As with most shoes the insole and arch support are inadequate. I switched it out with a Spenco insole with arch support and now they’re perfect.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Morton

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaws - Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Took my pair on about a 10 mile hike. Feet were pretty sore after the hike. Did some cruising around and a few short hikes over next 2-3 months. Noticed the plastic framing structure behind left heal had broke through the material and was sticking into my skin. Very uncomfortable and only got worse. Have rarely worn since (around the yard) and only with back of heal tapped. Avoid these - waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: karen Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes! I am just about to retire this ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes! I am just about to retire this pair after wearing them almost daily for well over a year. I wear them to walk the dog, hiking, mountain biking, and as casual shoes for work. Very comfortable and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of mountaineering and hiking and I wear my Keens wherever I go. I know that a lot hikers say the ankle support in a hiking shoe might not be enough while wearing a 70 pound pack, but I have never had a problem with these shoes. The material does break down after heavy use, but for the price you pay for these shoes, they are well worth it. I have owned 5 pairs in the last 6 years, so I hope that Keen will keep this design going. These are the most comfortable, rugged and nicest looking hiking shoes I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye09

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but run a little small.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Durable, support, grip. Make sure you order a half size larger than your normal shoe as they run a bit small.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Howard

customer_reviews.title: Shorter than average
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried these on I was excited about how comfortable they were, but after walking in them a while I realized my toe was pressing against the toe of the shoe. During the day this went from annoying to painful. Most shoes in my size have plenty of length for me, but these are definitely lacking in length. Before I purchased them I tried on two very similar competing brands and I could instantly tell the Keens were more comfortable. After a full day of walking my feet were sore. I think they are a great shoe, just needed a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G.

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Wore my first pair of these for many years before I finally wore them out. Just recently purchase two more pair. Love these shoes!!! I trade out the laces with the 'no tie' elastic ones and they slip off & one perfectly! Light weight & breathable; these are my 'go to' shoes for 'everyday' kind of use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott T. Grover

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe From KEEN
customer_reviews.text: This is the fifth pair of KEEN shoes that I have purchased. Others are boots, and sandals. Love the fit of all their footwear, really love the footbed. It is one of the few brands of shoes that I have found that feel good without inserts with my very flat feet.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough hiking shoes for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: These are great value shoes. This is my second pair, my original set lasted through 5 years of tough hiking and then daily wear. I upgraded the insoles to SuperFeet for better heel support.
customer_reviews.author: E.Stone

customer_reviews.title: No break-in period
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair so, obviously there is nothing to dislike. I do like the fact that I can take them out of the box and wear them with no break-in period.
customer_reviews.author: Carolee Kolmer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight hikers & multi-purpose shoe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these recently because I was trying to find a good pair of lightweight hikers that could also do double-duty as a cold weather casual shoe. These are definitely IT - I wore them during an extended drive (total of ten hrs. over two days) and they were perfect - comfortable, and absolutely breathable. One of the worst problems to have when driving long distances is having your foot overheat, causing discomfort that can distract from driving. These Keens were perfect - oh, and by the way, they were quite comfortable on short (2-3 mile) hikes in the Smokies! Highly recommended. Sizing was spot-on, as well.
customer_reviews.author: L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Fave
customer_reviews.text: These are my go too shoes. I am on my feet 12 hours a day and these are the best shoes I have found.
customer_reviews.author: PE

customer_reviews.title: Sizing runs half size smaller
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes but they do run small. This order was my 2nd pair and i already knew to order size 11 even though I wear 10.5 in all my other shoes. Also had to return the pair i ordered because the right shoe was even smaller length than it should have been (i consider as a defect). Measured inside length and clearly 1/4 inch shorter in the right shoe than the left and compared to my previous pair. But replaced by Amazon with no issue and this pair is good on the size. I'll probably buy another pair when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Keith E.

customer_reviews.title: Love the extra space in the toe area!
customer_reviews.text: I love these low cut hiking boots! They look cute with jeans and are very comfortable. These shoes have a wide toe area and do not cramp or pinch. They are great for short hikes. If I do serious hiking on super rugged terrain I would use my high top boots.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Keen is a reliable brand
customer_reviews.text: I love Keen shoes. I own many. The wide toe box is perfect for my feet. Unquestionably durability. I’ll keep on buying them. It’s an awesome shoe for work or pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Lowry

customer_reviews.title: Try Them, You'll Like Em...
customer_reviews.text: These have a wide toe box, only ones I have ever found to give me that extra room, I wear them with gel inserts, that extra room makes all the difference in the world, I usually get almost a year and a half of wear out of each pair, I walk/hike an average of 30 plus miles every week, this my third pair, also have a pair of Keen closed toe sandals, they are equally as great. Highly recommended and the most comfortable shoes after a few weeks break in period, I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: jose gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfort and function are married in this shoe for a great day out on a short walk or long hike.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Weller

customer_reviews.title: best ever
customer_reviews.text: Keen shoes are the best ever and i have to be on my feet all day. they are well worth the price!!
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Seems on par with the Keen brand shoes, comfortable, I had a feeling that it would run slightly small and ordered a half size up. Fits perfectly, will see if it holds up like last pair. I have heard that quality on Keen shoes has been slipping in last year or two as China takes over the manufacturing. Will update review as warranted
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very good...just what I wanted. Reasonable price and delivered on time. High quality materials, perfect fit and finish. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bucksnort

customer_reviews.title: worked well for me!
customer_reviews.text: i go through these shoes about every 6 months. every part holds up well except the plastic heel it wears out and causes blisters. i throw them away then
customer_reviews.author: cw

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's Voyageur-m Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description: Keep your cool under pressure with a low-profile hiking shoe. Mesh insets allow a continual airflow, while a stability shank and a rugged, high-traction outsole let you take on tough terrain with confidence.
feature_bullets: Care instructions -To treat day to day wear and tear, especially on lighter color leathers, we recommend using a leather cleaner and conditioner, found at most footwear dealers and/or shoe repair shops.
